bug.short_desc: recommended packages do not get installed in a default Workstation install, so fonts like Carlito/Caladea are missing

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
Installed Fedora Workstation 24 beta-1-4 ISO, got LibreOffice installed but no Carlito/Caladea fonts
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): libreoffice-core-5.1.3.1-1.fc24.x86_64
How reproducible:
always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. installed Fedora Workstation 24 beta-1-4, 2. rpm -qa | grep crosextra
Actual results:
no fonts
Expected results:
fonts
Additional info:
http://pkgs.fedoraproject.org/cgit/rpms/libreoffice.git/commit/?h=f24&id=43fec3aae003006c3acdb8c34fdb48dd79a02768
this commit switched from "Requires" to "Recommends" for the fonts, but according to rdieter the "Recommends" are ignored by the tools that build the workstation images.
so either back to "Requires", or manually add the pacakges to @libreoffice group in comps as a workaroun
I reckon back to Requires over faffing around with comps

just noticed there's a similar problem with "Supplements:"
i have only the "gen" vclplug installed despite running GNOME :(
